abstract: Federal appeals court in Kentucky upholds lower court decision to order Kim Davis, clerk in Rowan County, Ky, to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples, despite her objections to practice on religious grounds.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court in Kentucky on Wednesday affirmed a ruling ordering a county clerk who objects to same-sex marriage on religious grounds to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples.

headline.main: Court Rules Clerk Must Issue Licenses for Same-Sex Marriages
headline.print_headline: Court Rules Clerk Must Issue Licenses for Marriage

snippet: A federal appeals court in Kentucky on Wednesday affirmed a ruling ordering a county clerk who objects to same-sex marriage on religious grounds to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
